result.execSummary:
The defendant Anton J James was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and assessments, DV surcharge, DNA surcharge. Cash bail on deposit to be applied and balance to be returned to surety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anton J James

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (14 pages) commencing 08-25-2015 Sentencing received and filed.

Defendant Anton J James in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Anton J James in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court.    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 19 days time served.  Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and assessments, DV surcharge, DNA surcharge. Cash bail on deposit to be applied and balance to be returned to surety.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 1 Dismissed, But Read In. 

AS TO COUNT 2 AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. 

Filed, 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form. 

Case adjourned to branch 38 for Sentencing.

Defendant Anton J James in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Anton J James in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Anton J James not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst for Ben Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ben Lindsay later appeared via telephone. Case NOT scheduled for today's hearing. FILE NOT IN COURT. Case called at request of parties with new pending case before branch 23 to address joinder motion. State's motion for Joinder of 15CF3112 & 14CF5700, GRANTED over defendant's objection. Defense filed a substitution of judge on 15CF3112, that matter was transfered to Judge Wagner, Br. 38. Based on joinder of these matter for trial, court transfered this case to Br. 38. Court VACATED the Jury Trial date of 8/5/2015. Matter reset for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial within the speedy trial demand time limit.  Court ordered defendant produced for the Final Pretrial/Motion Hearing date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Received & Filed, Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn.

15RM028150  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-06-15

Defendant Anton J James in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Anton J James in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial. Court ordered all discovery and witness lists turned over and motions to be filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. Case adjourned to branch 36.  Jury trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact/NO FIREARMS Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ARACHEL L.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Anton J James in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Anton J James in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge GRADY, Branch 23.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
